meanings.sent1: The color of the sky is disputable among the children.
meanings.sent2: The decision to cancel the event was disputable by many attendees.
meanings.sent3: It's disputable whether the cat or the dog knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The line between right and wrong can be as disputable as a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the new dish was so disputable that everyone had a different opinion.

meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was disputable among the audience members.
meanings.sent2: The topic of climate change is highly disputable in scientific circles.
meanings.sent3: It's disputable whether the sun or the moon is bigger in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her talent on the piano was as disputable as the existence of unicorns.
meanings.sent5: The value of the antique vase was so disputable that experts couldn't agree on its worth.
